books.title: Meditations — Book II
books.author: Marcus Aurelius (tr. George Long, 1862)
books.lore: Used in resilience circles to rehearse the Stoic cooperative vow before dawn meditations.
books.excerpt: Begin the morning by saying to thyself, I shall meet with the busy-body, the ungrateful, arrogant, deceitful, envious, unsocial…
books.rightsNotes: Project Gutenberg mirror confirms U.S. public-domain status.

books.title: Tao Te Ching — Chapter 1
books.author: Laozi (tr. James Legge, 1891)
books.lore: Placed in the orientation vestibule to remind initiates that the name is never the path.
books.excerpt: The Tao that can be trodden is not the enduring and unchanging Tao. The name that can be named is not the enduring and unchanging name…
books.rightsNotes: Project Gutenberg mirror confirms U.S. public-domain status.

books.title: The Dhammapada — Twin Verses
books.author: Anonymous Pāli verses (tr. F. Max Müller, 1881)
books.lore: Recited after reconciliation circles to anchor non-retaliation covenants.
books.excerpt: All that we are is the result of what we have thought: it is founded on our thoughts, it is made up of our thoughts…
books.rightsNotes: Project Gutenberg mirror confirms U.S. public-domain status.

books.title: The Bhagavad-Gita — Chapter II
books.author: Vyasa (tr. Sir Edwin Arnold, 1885)
books.lore: Serves the martial devotees who study compassionate duty before taking stewardship oaths.
books.excerpt: Thou grievest where no grief should be! thou speak'st words lacking wisdom; for the wise in heart mourn not for those that live, nor those that die…
books.rightsNotes: Project Gutenberg mirror confirms U.S. public-domain status.
